moves.1. d4: Routine Openings For These Games With Tom And I
moves.2. e3: white bishop and you could say queen which has more options now
moves.2... Nc6: Black then moves for center position for next move
moves.3. Nd2: whites move in this position to help possible e4
moves.3... e5: Black move to take control of center
moves.4... Nxe5: black removes pond and gains control
moves.5. Ngf3: white to force trade or back up knight
moves.6. c4: white to open up a row for the queen
moves.6... Nf6: black counters with horse to protect pond in center position
moves.7. cxd5: white forces a trade with black to open up center board
moves.7... Nxd5: black takes and still has center position
moves.8. Nxe5: white forces another trade with a black centered position piece
moves.8... Bxe5: black takes and regains center control
moves.9. Nf3: white persistant in moving black from center
moves.9... Qd6: black moves queen up to backup bishop and possible check and attack at whites front row.
moves.11... O-O: black beats him to the castle! :)
moves.12. O-O: white follows expecting to protect and proceed for the end game!
moves.12... Qh4: black sees glory of a check mate in site!
moves.13. Nf3: I believe white looks to have an advantage in moving horse to f3 rather than using g3
moves.13... Qh5: blacks trap is in effect look do you see it?
moves.14. Qxd5: white makes a great lookin move to move ahead a horse but it wasnt to free
moves.14... Bxh2+:
blacks bishop settles with a check and queen is for blacks discretion. 
white resigns
